newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Placer puts Gibraltar stake on sale.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Placer puts Gibraltar stake on sale.

text.p: Placer Dome Inc said it its wholly owned unit, Placer Dome Canada Ltd, has retained Nesbitt Burns Inc to identify strategic buyers for its 30.8 percent stake in Gibraltar Mines Ltd.

The proposed sale was in keeping with Placer Dome's focus on growth in gold, it said in a statement made in Vancouver and released here, where Placer Dome is also listed on the Australian Stock Exchange.

It said Gibraltar Mines owns and operates the McLeese Lake copper mine near Williams Lake, British Columbia, and owns 100 percent of the Lomas Bayas and Fortuna de Cobre oxide copper deposits in Chile.

Placer said Gibraltar recently announced it had obtained a bank financing commitment of US$140 million for development of the Lomas Bayas project, which together with the Fortuna property, has total reserves and geological resources of 8.92 billion pounds of contained copper.
The brief Placer statement did not state the number of shares it holds in Gibraltar and company officials in Vancouver were not available for comment.
Gibraltar shares last traded at C$6.05 on Tuesday.
